Row.Text: Units move through Forest and Jungle in friendly territory as if they were Roads. These tiles can be used to establish [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connections upon researching The Wheel. Forest and Jungle extend length of Trade Routes as if they were Roads.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Units move through Forest and Jungle in friendly territory as if they were Roads. These tiles can be used to establish [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connections upon researching The Wheel. Forest and Jungle extend length of Trade Routes as if they were Roads.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](PL_PL text) [ENDCOLOR]Units move through Forest and Jungle in friendly territory as if they were Roads. These tiles can be used to establish [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connections upon researching The Wheel. Forest and Jungle extend length of Trade Routes as if they were Roads.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]Units move through Forest and Jungle in friendly territory as if they were Roads. These tiles can be used to establish [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connections upon researching The Wheel. Forest and Jungle extend length of Trade Routes as if they were Roads.

Unique Iroquois replacement for the Workshop. Cheaper to construct. Allows [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to be moved from this City along Trade Routes inside your Civilization. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from each worked Forest or Jungle tile.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Unique Iroquois replacement for the Workshop. Cheaper to construct. Allows [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to be moved from this City along Trade Routes inside your Civilization. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from each worked Forest or Jungle tile.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](PL_PL text) [ENDCOLOR]Unique Iroquois replacement for the Workshop. Cheaper to construct. Allows [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to be moved from this City along Trade Routes inside your Civilization. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from each worked Forest or Jungle tile.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]Unique Iroquois replacement for the Workshop. Cheaper to construct. Allows [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to be moved from this City along Trade Routes inside your Civilization. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from each worked Forest or Jungle tile.

The Longhouse is the Iroquois unique building, replacing the Workshop. In addition to the regular abilities of a Workshop, the Longhouse is cheaper to construct, and it also increases the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output of each Forest and Jungle within the City's radius.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]The Longhouse is the Iroquois unique building, replacing the Workshop. In addition to the regular abilities of a Workshop, the Longhouse is cheaper to construct, and it also increases the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output of each Forest and Jungle within the City's radius.

In addition to the regular abilities of a Workshop, the Longhouse is cheaper to construct, and it also increases the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output of each Forest and Jungle within the City's radius.

In addition to the regular abilities of a Workshop, the Longhouse is cheaper to construct, and it also increases the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output of each Forest and Jungle within the City's radius.
